sentence.Network_en: She bowed her head in a gesture somehow reminiscent of royalty.

sentence.Network_en: Royalty is regarded with unquestioned reverence.

sentence.Network_en: The gala evening was attended by royalty and politicians.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French roialte, from roial (see royal). The sense 'royal right (especially over minerals') (late 15th cent.) developed into the sense 'payment made by a mineral producer to the site owner' (mid 19th cent.), which was then transferred to payments for the use of patents and published materials

entry.def: The members of royal families are sometimes referred to as royalty .

example.ex: Royalty and government leaders from all around the world are gathering in Japan.
example.tran: 世界各国的王室成员和政府首脑齐聚日本。
王室成员参加的一个庆典

entry.def: Royalties are payments made to authors and musicians when their work is sold or performed. They usually receive a fixed percentage of the profits from these sales or performances.

example.ex: I lived on about £3,000 a year from the royalties on my book.
example.tran: 我靠着写书得来的每年约3,000英镑的版税生活。

entry.def: Payments made to someone whose invention, idea, or property is used by a commercial company can be referred to as royalties .

example.ex: The royalties enabled the inventor to re-establish himself in business.
example.tran: 专利使用费让这位发明家得以再次立足于商界。

means.word_mean: 1. payment to the holder of a patent or copyright or resource for the right to use their property;

Sentence.sentence: And now, if you'll walk this way, ladies and gentlemen, the next room we're going to see is the room in which the family used to hold their formal dinner parties and even occasionally entertain heads of state and royalty.

sentences.en: The flag is only raised when royalty is present.
sentences.cn: 只有在王室成员在场的时候才升起这面旗帜。

sentences.en: The writer gets a ten percent royalty on each copy of his book.
sentences.cn: 作者从每本卖出的书中可得到百分之十的版税。

jushi.chinese: 他声称跟王室有亲戚关系。
